# Publications relating to hybrid halide perovskite solar cells from the Materials Design Group at Imperial College London

### Updated 16.12.17

## Reviews and Perspectives

Butler, K. T., Frost, J. M. & Walsh, A. Ferroelectric materials for solar energy conversion: photoferroics revisited. Energy Environ. Sci. 8, 838–848 (2015). http://pubs.rsc.org/en/Content/ArticleLanding/2015/EE/C4EE03523B

Walsh, A. Principles of Chemical Bonding and Band Gap Engineering in Hybrid Organic–Inorganic Halide Perovskites. J. Phys. Chem. C 119, 5755–5760 (2015). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/jp512420b

Walsh, A., Padure, N. P. & Il Seok, S. Physical chemistry of hybrid perovskite solar cells. Phys. Chem. Chem. Phys. 18, 27024–27025 (2016). http://xlink.rsc.org/?DOI=C6CP90212J

Frost, J. M. & Walsh, A. What Is Moving in Hybrid Halide Perovskite Solar Cells? Acc. Chem. Res. 49, 528–535 (2016). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acs.accounts.5b00431

Whalley, L. D., Frost, J. M., Jung, Y.-K. & Walsh, A. Perspective: Theory and simulation of hybrid halide perovskites. J. Chem. Phys. 146, 220901 (2017). http://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4984964

## Electronic Structure and Optical Properties

Brivio, F., Walker, A. B. & Walsh, A. Structural and electronic properties of hybrid perovskites for high-efficiency thin-film photovoltaics from first-principles. APL Mater. 1, 042111 (2013). http://scitation.aip.org/content/aip/journal/aplmater/1/4/10.1063/1.4824147

Frost, J. M. et al. Atomistic origins of high-performance in hybrid halide perovskite solar cells. Nano Lett. 14, 2584–2590 (2014). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/nl500390f

Brivio, F., Butler, K. T., Walsh, A. & Van Schilfgaarde, M. Relativistic quasiparticle self-consistent electronic structure of hybrid halide perovskite photovoltaic absorbers. Phys. Rev. B - Condens. Matter Mater. Phys. 89, 155204 (2014). http://journals.aps.org/prb/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevB.89.155204

Butler, K. T., Frost, J. M. & Walsh, A. Band alignment of the hybrid halide perovskites CH3NH3PbCl3, CH3NH3PbBr3 and CH3NH3PbI3. Mater. Horiz. 2, 228–231 (2015). http://pubs.rsc.org/en/Content/ArticleLanding/2015/MH/c4mh00174e

Protesescu, L. et al. Nanocrystals of Cesium Lead Halide Perovskites (CsPbX3, X = Cl, Br, and I): Novel Optoelectronic Materials Showing Bright Emission with Wide Color Gamut. Nano Lett. 15, 3692–3696 (2015). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/nl5048779

Grancini, G. et al. Role of microstructure in the electron–hole interaction of hybrid lead halide perovskites. Nat. Photonics 7, 695–702 (2015). http://www.nature.com/nphoton/journal/v9/n10/full/nphoton.2015.151.html

Leguy, A. et al. Experimental and theoretical optical properties of methylammonium lead halide perovskites. Nanoscale 8, 6317–6327 (2016). http://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2016/nr/c5nr05435d

Azarhoosh, P., McKechnie, S., Frost, J. M., Walsh, A. & van Schilfgaarde, M. Relativistic origin of slow electron-hole recombination in hybrid halide perovskite solar cells. APL Mater. 4, 091501 (2016).
http://scitation.aip.org/content/aip/journal/aplmater/4/9/10.1063/1.4955028

Frost, J. M., Whalley, L. D. & Walsh, A. Slow cooling of hot polarons in halide perovskite solar cells. ACS Energy Lett. 2, 2647–2652 (2017). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acsenergylett.7b00862

## Point and Extended Defects

Walsh, A., Scanlon, D. O., Chen, S., Gong, X. G. & Wei, S.-H. Self-regulation mechanism for charged point defects in hybrid-halide perovskites. Angew. Chemie Int. Ed. 54, 1791–1794 (2015). http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/anie.201409740/abstract

Eames, C. et al. Ionic transport in hybrid lead iodide perovskite solar cells. Nat. Commun. 6, 7497 (2015). http://www.nature.com/ncomms/2015/150624/ncomms8497/full/ncomms8497.html

1. Whalley, L. D., Crespo-Otero, R. & Walsh, A. H-Center and V-Center Defects in Hybrid Halide Perovskites. ACS Energy Lett. 2, 2713–2714 (2017). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acsenergylett.7b00995

## Molecular Disorder and Phonons

Frost, J. M., Butler, K. T. & Walsh, A. Molecular ferroelectric contributions to anomalous hysteresis in hybrid perovskite solar cells. APL Mater. 2, 081506 (2014). http://scitation.aip.org/content/aip/journal/aplmater/2/8/10.1063/1.4890246

Leguy, A. M. A. et al. The dynamics of methylammonium ions in hybrid organic-inorganic perovskite solar cells. Nat. Commun. 6, 7124 (2015). http://www.nature.com/ncomms/2015/150529/ncomms8124/full/ncomms8124.html

Bakulin, A. A. et al. Real-time observation of organic cation reorientation in methylammonium lead-iodide perovskites. J. Phys. Chem. Lett. 6, 3663–3669 (2015). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acs.jpclett.5b01555

Brivio, F. et al. Lattice dynamics and vibrational spectra of the orthorhombic, tetragonal, and cubic phases of methylammonium lead iodide. Phys. Rev. B 92, 144308 (2015). http://journals.aps.org/prb/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevB.92.144308

da Silva, E. L., Skelton, J. M., Parker, S. C. & Walsh, A. Phase stability and transformations in the halide perovskite CsSnI3. Phys. Rev. B 91, 144107 (2015). http://link.aps.org/doi/10.1103/PhysRevB.91.144107

Weller, M. T., Weber, O. J., Frost, J. M. & Walsh, A. Cubic perovskite structure of black formamidinium lead iodide, α-[HC(NH2)2]PbI3, at 298 K. J. Phys. Chem. Lett. 6, 3209–3212 (2015). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acs.jpclett.5b01432

Brivio, F., Caetano, C. & Walsh, A. Thermodynamic Origin of Photoinstability in the CH3NH3Pb(I1−xBrx)3 Hybrid Halide Perovskite Alloy. J. Phys. Chem. Lett. 7, 1083–1087 (2016). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acs.jpclett.6b00226

Leguy, A. M. A. et al. Dynamic disorder, phonon lifetimes, and the assignment of modes to the vibrational spectra of methylammonium lead halide perovskites. Phys. Chem. Chem. Phys. (2016). http://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2016/cp/c6cp03474h

Whalley, L. D., Skelton, J. M., Frost, J. M. & Walsh, A. Phonon anharmonicity, lifetimes, and thermal transport in CH3NH3PbI3 from many-body perturbation theory. Phys. Rev. B 94, 220301(R) (2016). http://journals.aps.org/prb/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevB.94.220301

Beecher, A. N. et al. Direct observation of dynamic symmetry breaking above room temperature in methylammonium lead iodide perovskite. ACS Energy Lett. 1, 880–887 (2016). https://doi.org/10.1021/acsenergylett.6b00381

Yang, R. X., Skelton, J. M., da Silva, E. L., Frost, J. M. & Walsh, A. Spontaneous Octahedral Tilting in the Cubic Inorganic Caesium Halide Perovskites CsSn3 and CsPbX3 (X = F, Cl, Br, I). J. Phys. Chem. Lett. 8, 4720–2726 (2017). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acs.jpclett.7b02423

Zhao, D. et al. Low-frequency optical phonon modes and carrier mobility in the halide perovskite CH3NH3PbBr3 using terahertz time-domain spectroscopy. Appl. Phys. Lett. 111, 201903 (2017). http://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4993524

Svane, K. L. et al. How Strong is the Hydrogen Bond in Hybrid Perovskites? J. Phys. Chem. Lett. 8, 6154–6159 (2017). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/acs.jpclett.7b03106

## New and Alternative Materials

Hendon, C. H., Yang, R. X., Burton, L. a. & Walsh, A. Assessment of polyanion (BF4− and PF6−) substitutions in hybrid halide perovskites. J. Mater. Chem. A 3, 9067–9070 (2015). http://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2015/ta/c4ta05284f

Yang, R. X., Butler, K. T. & Walsh, A. Assessment of Hybrid Organic-Inorganic Antimony Sulfides for Earth-Abundant Photovoltaic Applications. J. Phys. Chem. Lett. 6, 5009–5014 (2015). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acs.jpclett.5b02555

Butler, K. T., Kumagai, Y., Oba, F. & Walsh, A. Screening procedure for structurally and electronically matched contact layers for high-performance solar cells: hybrid perovskites. J. Mater. Chem. C 4, 1149–1158 (2016). http://pubs.rsc.org/en/Content/ArticleLanding/2016/TC/c5tc04091d

Ganose, A. M., Butler, K. T., Walsh, A. & Scanlon, D. O. Relativistic electronic structure and band alignment of BiSI and BiSeI: candidate photovoltaic materials. J. Mater. Chem. A 4, 2060–2068 (2016). http://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2016/ta/c5ta09612j

Butler, K. T. et al. Quasi-particle electronic band structure and alignment of the V-VI-VII semiconductors SbSI, SbSBr, and SbSeI for solar cells. Appl. Phys. Lett. 108, 112103 (2016). http://scitation.aip.org/content/aip/journal/apl/108/11/10.1063/1.4943973

Bhachu, D. S. et al. Bismuth oxyhalides: synthesis, structure and photoelectrochemical activity. Chem. Sci. 7, 4832–4841 (2016). http://pubs.rsc.org/is/content/articlelanding/2016/sc/c6sc00389c

Savory, C. N., Walsh, A. & Scanlon, D. O. Can Pb-free Halide Double Perovskites Support High-effciency Solar Cells? ACS Energy Lett. 1, 949–955 (2016). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acsenergylett.6b00471

Jung, Y.-K., Lee, J.-H., Walsh, A. & Soon, A. Influence of Rb/Cs cation-exchange on inorganic Sn halide perovskites: From chemical structure to physical properties. Chem. Mater. 29, 3181–3188 (2017). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acs.chemmater.7b00260

Kaltzoglou, A. et al. Trimethylsulfonium Lead Triiodide: An Air-Stable Hybrid Halide Perovskite. Inorg. Chem. 56, 6302–6309 (2017). http://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acs.inorgchem.7b00395
